III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12308 Application submission
Section (1) An agency shall act on a completed and signed application.
Description
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that licensing of the home has been delayed.
1

Investigation The agency Chief Administrator was notified of the complaint
via telephone on October 30, 2023. The Chief Administrator
referred me to the agency licensing supervisor and licensing
worker.
Licensing Supervisor was contacted via telephone on
October 31, 2023. A voice mail message was left requesting a
return phone call. Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via
telephone on December 12, 2023. Licensing Supervisor reported
Foster Parent has been difficult to work with as she is slow to
respond to communication attempts and to submit licensing
documents. Licensing Supervisor reported the agency has been
doing what they can in a timely manner to license Foster Parent,
but the process has been slow for the aforementioned reasons.
Staff 1, the agency licensing worker, was interviewed via
telephone on November 13, 2023. Staff 1 reported the
prospective foster parent, hereafter referred to as Foster Parent,
attended an orientation on March 7, 2023, but the agency did not
receive a signed application from the Foster Parent until July 10,
2023. Staff 1 reported licensing activity has been occurring
consistently since receipt of the application. Staff 1 added the
Foster Parent has been slow and inconsistent in submitting
licensing related documents.
Foster Parent was interviewed via telephone on December 11,
2023. Foster Parent reported the licensing process is moving
forward. Foster Parent reported she submitted the licensing
application on July 10, 2023. Foster Parent reported she had
attended an orientation with the agency in March 2023. Foster
Parent was asked about the gap in time from the orientation in
March to the July submission of the application. Foster Parent
responded, “That was my fault”. Foster Parent reported she was
not involved in the licensing process during the time period and
had attended other agency orientations. Foster Parent reported
she feels the licensing process was slow from the time she
submitted the application until the in-home visit by Staff 1 on
October 30, 2023.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Case File Review: Social work contacts were reviewed. From
July 13, 2023, to December 11, 2023, there were twenty-seven
contacts recorded. A review of the contacts indicate licensing
activity such as documents sent to Foster Parent and documents
received. A number of the contacts document verbal
communication between Staff 1 and Foster Parent. A six-day
2

period from September 14, 2023 to September 21, 2023
documents three attempts from the agency to contact the Foster
Parent with contact being made on September 21, 2023.
Analysis The Foster Parent acknowledged from the time of her orientation
on March 7, 2023, to July 10, 2023, she was not actively involved
in the licensing process. From July 13, 2023, to December 11,
2023, there are twenty-seven contacts including an October 30,
2023, visit to the home. Licensing Supervisor and Staff 1 each
reported Foster Parent is slow to complete and submit documents
and this has affected the licensing process.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The recommendation is for the continuance of the regular license.
